parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To punish, avenge myself on. From a comparative of time and ouros; properly, to protect one's honor, i.e. To avenge.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To force, compel, constrain, urge. From anagke; to necessitate.
From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be madly enraged with. From en and mainomai; to rave on, i.e. Rage at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
